title: Lauren_Mills commented Fourth quarter set for M&A upturn
text:
Comments (1) 
A law firm is predicting an upturn in corporate deal making in the run-up to Christmas. 
Shakespeare Martineau, a Legal500 firm with an office in Colton Square, Leicester, anticipates an increase in mergers and acquisitions across the East Midlands in the fourth quarter of this year, as "confidence returns post-Brexit". 
In the run up to the referendum, the firm said it saw a small hold up in the number of deals under way, which it attributed to uncertainty surrounding life outside the EU. 
This followed data from Thomson Reuters showing the value of deals announced in the UK so far this year is around half the £164 billion, including net debt, announced at the same time in 2015. 
However, in the two months since the EU vote, Shakespeare Martineau has already seen considerably higher levels of interest in M&A deals pipeline activity. 
The firm has been involved in nine deal completions, worth £29 million in the East Midlands since Brexit and it is expecting activity to continue to increase in the fourth quarter. 
Roy Botterill, partner at Shakespeare Martineau in Leicester, said: "A quiet few months for M&A was very much expected in the months following the referendum result, and many firms adopted a 'wait-and-see' approach. 
"Despite this, entrepreneurs have continued to focus on their own needs and aspirations and after the initial few days of uncertainty most businesses in the local area are pressing ahead with their own plans. The work with which we have been involved includes a high proportion of foreign investment; and Britain remains one of the most attractive destinations for investors. 
"It will be interesting to see whether this continues into Q4 but the signs are looking favourable. We anticipate that firms will be left feeling more encouraged to make investment decisions and things will only continue to improve as market volatility settles and more buying opportunities emerge."
